features: 【Maximize Space Efficiently】Be sure to measure the (width / height / depth) size of your cabinet before purchasing the MUDEELA pan rack to ensure that the size of our pot rack suits your cabinet. Minimum Cabinet Size Required: Width≥22'' ; Height≥16.96''. NOTICE: NOT for Heavy-duty cookware. MUDEELA compact pots and pans organizer frees up space without taking up additional. 8-tier ample space allows our pan organizer rack for cabinet to fit frying pans, baking pans, cutting boards, pot lids, etc. Suits kitchen, countertop, cabinet, and pantry.
【Fits 6"-11" pots and pans】NOTE: The middle bars of the main frame may take up some space. So it's best to place the 6"-9" pots on the side without bars, and the 10"-11" pots on the other side.

【Wobble-Free & Rock-Steady】Enjoy a pot organizer rack for under cabinet as steady as a rock with a MUDEELA pot and pan organizer for cabinet. The flat-heel design and the mortise-tenon joint ensure a secure grip and good load capacity. No shaking, budging, or collapsing even when you pick & place from one side.

【3 DIY Methods Optional】Get cookware organized at your fingertips with a MUDEELA pan organizer rack for cabinet. You can easily DIY the pan rack in minutes without tools: use it on one side, put it upright on two sides, or let it lie flat. Our pot rack can beautify your kitchen in a jiffy.

【Adjustable and Tool-Free Assembly】MUDEELA pot organizer rack for under cabinet can be set without tools in just a few minutes. Dividers of the cabinet organizer can be adjusted to fit pots of various heights, allowing you to easily grab the right pot without wasting time digging into your cabinet.

How to Install Take out the dividers To avoid scratches, please carefully take out the dividers one by one. Tauten the bottom support Tauten the bottom support in the direction of arrow to enhance tension before installation. Install the bottom support Install the bottom support to the main frame and make sure the end is completely inserted into the holes. Insert the M-shaped dividers Flip the main frame and insert the M-shaped dividers into other slots according to your needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really great space and pan saver!
reviews.reviewText: This is a really nice Pots and Pans Organizer that will definitely prolong the life of your pots and pans as long as you use it. If you didn't know, tossing your pots and pans into the same area without regard to their individuality will only lessen the lifespan of most of them; especially non-stick pans. A few good scratches and the pan loses it's slickness and it's all downhill from there.The packaging was solid and took me a minute to figure out that you had to pop out each "shelf" individually to properly unpack this item. Note that this step is in the instructions but I never think to read the instructions before unpacking an item, so, lesson learned :)It's fairly easy to assemble and pretty forgiving if you put the shelves in incorrectly. I suggest having all your pots and pans out and figure out your setup before putting this in your cabinet. Also, it's fairly wide and you should consider the widths of your pots and pans in addition when checking to see if it will fit in your cabinets.The item itself is very solid, the bottom legs are pretty ingenious, and it seems of good enough quality to last a while.My only suggestion to the manufacturer would be to put some non-slip material on the bottom of the item as it does tend to slide around when putting pots and pans into it once inside my cabinet.This is a solid item and definitely valuable if you want to organize and protect your pots and pans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very easy to install and stable
reviews.reviewText: This fits easily in my builder grade cabinets. I no longer need to stack and protect my nonstick pans I can easily retrieve the pan I need without unstacking and restacking pans. The apparatus remains stable regardless of the pan I remove. Very pleased.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Highly Versatile and Effective Solution for Kitchen Chaos
reviews.reviewText: The MUDEELA Pots and Pans Organizer is a game-changing addition to kitchen cabinet organization. With its 8-tier design and three DIY methods for installation, it addresses the common kitchen dilemma of managing bulky cookware in limited spaces. After spending several weeks with this organizer, I feel it lives up to most of its promises, warranting a 4-star rating. Here’s my detailed analysis:Build Quality & MaterialFirstly, the material is sturdy and dependable. Constructed from heavy-duty iron with a smooth black coating, it withstands the weight of various pots and pans without showing signs of fatigue. The quality of the material puts it a notch above many competing products I’ve tried, such as the SimpleHouseware Kitchen Cabinet Pantry Pan and Pot Organizer, which used lighter metals that flexed under weight.Installation & CustomizationOne of the standout features is the adaptability in its installation. You can opt for a single rack, two separate racks, or even an expandable rack. This customization is particularly useful when you have cabinets of varying sizes. Installation took me around 30 minutes, and the included instruction manual was fairly easy to follow.VersatilityThe organizer’s 8-tiers offer ample room for an array of items. I stored cast-iron skillets, saucepans, frying pans, and even lids. The ability to adjust the height of each tier is an excellent feature. The versatility of this organizer separates it from more rigid alternatives.Space ManagementPre-MUDEELA, my cabinet was a jumbled mess, causing me unnecessary stress whenever I needed to find the right pan. Now, each item has its designated spot, making it significantly easier to retrieve and store my cookware.Pros: 1. High-Quality Material: Robust and durable, designed for long-term use. 2. Versatile Customization: Three installation methods offer flexibility for various cabinet sizes. 3. Space-Efficient: Optimizes storage space, making your kitchen more organized. 4. Ease of Use: Once installed, accessing your pots and pans becomes a breeze. 5. Adjustable Tiers: Provides the ability to fine-tune the arrangement based on cookware dimensions.Cons: 1. Instruction Manual: Could be more detailed for those not adept at DIY projects. 2. Stability: While generally sturdy, the organizer can wobble if not evenly loaded. 3. Price Point: Slightly more expensive than some competitors, but you get what you pay for.ComparisonWhen comparing this to the SimpleHouseware Kitchen Cabinet Organizer, MUDEELA offers superior build quality and flexibility. The competitor fell short in both stability and adjustability, making MUDEELA the better choice for those willing to invest a bit more for quality.Usage ExperienceI’ve had the organizer installed for one month in a moderate-sized kitchen cabinet. The conditions have been typical—ambient room temperature, no exposure to excessive moisture or heat. Over the weeks, the organizer has held up impeccably, providing consistent performance without any degradation in stability or appearance.Extended Tips for Buyers:If you’re considering this organizer, take accurate measurements of your cabinet and cookware beforehand to ensure they align with the product dimensions. Additionally, if you’re not skilled at DIY tasks, you might find the installation a tad challenging. However, don’t let that deter you; the end result is well worth the effort.Final VerdictThe MUDEELA Pots and Pans Organizer has transformed my kitchen storage setup, injecting order into what was once chaos. While it does have a couple of minor drawbacks, they’re easily overshadowed by its multiple strengths.In summary, this is a product that knows its target audience well and delivers on its promises. If you’re tired of navigating through a cluttered cabinet to find that one elusive saucepan, MUDEELA provides an efficient, elegant solution. Four stars well earned.I hope this comprehensive review assists you in making an informed decision. Thank you for reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This are perfect!!!
reviews.reviewText: This is perfect for a cluttered cabinet filled with multiple pots and pans! This makes my cabinet look very nice and organized now. It is a tad bit not as sturdy as i would like it to be but as long as you even out the weight on each side of it you forget about it. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does the job and frees up space
reviews.reviewText: Makes it really easy to organize your pots and pans cabinet. Definitely easier to grab a pot or a pan from the rack while keeping everything nice and neat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Kind of flimsy for all my pans. I plan to use it sideways now in a drawer instead because pans bounce when you put them on and take them off and overall it isn’t terribly sturdy. Was easy enough to put together although the powder coated scratched off as I was attaching one of the shelves. Just okay for the price, it’ll do the job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fits well, very sturdy. I highly recommend-
reviews.reviewText: I am thrilled about the difference this item makes in my happiness in my kitchen. I always dreaded fishing out pits and pans for their messy stacks. This takes care of all of that. Everything has its place. I store the lid on top of each pan or skillet, my Dutch oven and cast iron skillet go on the bottom since they are the heaviest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Eliminates the frustration of finding the right pan
reviews.reviewText: Arrived quickly, easy to put together. After figuring out how to use them best in my cabinet with the number of pans I have, I used one on its side and the other standing (1 purchased 2). It makes it easy to find pans and you don’t get the loud noise of fumbling through tops and pans. The pans and tops are not always really easy to remove, depending upon how you have them but it’s much better than what I have. I wish I had a before picture. But supplying an after photo. So far happy with the purchase.

Great rack! Easy to assemble and held all my pots with some room for more. Even assembled it on the kitchen floor, put the pots on to make sure they'd fit and was able to lift the rack and carry it to the cabinet without it collapsing or breaking at all. Nice and sturdy, I'm very pleased.

I like the organizer and that I can readjust and change it easily if I want to. It doesn't fit where I had planned for it to fit (my fault I am sure) and with the pots I wanted it to fit with (they don't want to sit straight on the rungs for some reason), but it is doing a great job of holding my pot lids which were the biggest issue as they kept sliding off the pots and almost breaking when in the cupboard as well as just taking up too much cupboard space to leave the lids on their own pots. So, great job! I will update my review if anything changes.

Bought this organizer for my messy cabinet a week ago and here are my thoughts:pros:- super easy to install and setup, took me less than 10 mins in total to get it in place inside my cabinet- silicone offers good protection for your pans and pots- great organization without having to put your pans on top of each other (that's what I used to do, it could get dirty if the bottom is not cleaned well or potentially damage the pans on the bottom)- flexibility in terms of orientation (horizontal or vertical pan layout, I chose horizontal as it can hold the most pans with the space I have)cons:- the upper levels are a little flimsy so I probably wouldn't put the heavy pots (cast iron) there, stainless steel ones are totally okay

I was hoping to be able to use this in my cupboard, but it doesn’t fit. It holds my ninja pots and pans, and they almost didn’t fit. It sits on my counter and I actually have to remove one of the pots off the top rack to open my cupboard above it. Also, the smaller pan doesn’t sit on it very well.
Just what I needed to organize my pots and pans. All shelves are adjustable to what you need.
